_meta.purpose: Ground truth for Chrome extension behavioral analysis - Grammarly Extension
_meta.scope: Evaluates 9 sections: metadata, permissions, components, network, messaging, storage, workflows, privacy, risks
_meta.methodology: First 3 sections manually verified from manifest.json. Network/messaging/storage semi-automated (models discover, human verifies). Workflows/privacy/risks evaluated qualitatively.

metadata.name: Grammarly: AI Writing Assistant and Grammar Checker App
metadata.description: Improve your writing with all-in-one assistanceâ€”including generative AI, grammar check, and more.

endpoints.purpose: Primary telemetry and event logging endpoint.
Serves static assets for the extension.
API definitions for the Core API.
Retrieves page-specific configuration for the extension.
WebSocket for real-time communication with Core API (wildcard).
WebSocket for real-time communication with Core API.

workflows.name: User Authentication and Authorization
steps: Initiate OAuth 2.0 flow with Grammarly authentication services
Handle multi-environment authentication (production, preprod, QA)
Store authentication tokens (OAuth tokens, refresh tokens) in chrome.storage
Establish session synchronization across extension components
Validate user permissions and subscription tier

workflows.name: Text Processing and Grammar Checking
triggers: User typing in supported text fields
Content script injection on page load
steps: Capture text input from web page text fields via content scripts
Establish WebSocket connection to CAPI for real-time checking
Send text to Core API (CAPI) for grammar and style analysis
Receive suggestions and corrections from API
Display inline suggestions and highlights in the UI
Track user acceptance or rejection of suggestions
Apply corrections when user accepts suggestions

workflows.name: Feature Experimentation and A/B Testing
steps: Retrieve current feature gates and experiment assignments from properties/treatment services
Apply feature configurations to modify extension behavior
Track feature usage and interaction metrics
Log experiment exposures and outcomes
Report experiment results to analytics pipeline

workflows.name: Telemetry and Analytics Collection
steps: Collect user behavior data and interaction events
Aggregate performance metrics and error reports
Batch telemetry data for transmission
Transmit data to multiple analytics endpoints (felog, femetrics, gnar)
Store temporary analytics data in local storage

workflows.name: Subscription and Billing Management
steps: Validate user subscription tier and entitlements
Display upgrade prompts for premium features
Handle premium feature access control
Redirect to subscription management pages
Track subscription-related user interactions

workflows.name: Cross-Platform Integration
steps: Inject platform-specific content scripts (Google Docs, Gmail, etc.)
Establish communication with desktop application via native messaging
Adapt text processing for platform-specific editors
Handle platform-specific authentication and features
Coordinate with external integrations (Coda, Superhuman)

data_categories: Authentication credentials (OAuth tokens, refresh tokens, session tokens)
Behavioral analytics (typing patterns, feature usage, interaction metrics)
Device and browser information (user agent, browser version, extension version)
privacy.minimization: INSUFFICIENT - Extension collects extensive telemetry data including detailed user behavior tracking, comprehensive analytics across 30+ event types, and persistent storage of user-generated content. Collection extends beyond what is strictly necessary for core grammar checking functionality.
privacy.consent: UNCLEAR - No explicit consent mechanism observed for comprehensive data collection, particularly for analytics, behavioral tracking, and third-party data sharing. User consent for core functionality (grammar checking) does not explicitly cover extensive telemetry and analytics.
privacy.retention: MIXED - Retention policies vary by data type: session data cleared on session end, some analytics retained for 30-90 days, user profiles and authentication tokens retained indefinitely or until logout. No comprehensive, user-facing retention policy documented in code.

third_parties.name: Google (Accounts, Docs, Gmail)
third_parties.purpose: Authentication via OAuth, platform integration for document editing

third_parties.name: Iterable
third_parties.purpose: In-app messaging, marketing automation, and user engagement tracking

privacy.policy_compliance: POTENTIAL NON-COMPLIANCE - Extension exhibits characteristics that may violate GDPR (lack of explicit consent, excessive data collection, unclear retention policies), CCPA (limited transparency about data sales/sharing), and Chrome Web Store policies (extensive tracking without clear disclosure). Special category data processing (professional, educational content) lacks adequate safeguards.

risks.justification: Extension processes and transmits user-generated text content including potentially sensitive personal, professional, and educational information to remote servers. Text is sent to CAPI endpoints and potentially shared with third-party AI services. No evidence of client-side anonymization or encryption before transmission beyond standard HTTPS.

Extension requests broad permissions including access to all URLs (http://*/*, https://*/*), cookies, tabs, scripting, and storage. Host permissions allow interception and modification of content on all websites. Capabilities extend beyond what is strictly necessary for core grammar checking functionality.

Comprehensive user behavior tracking across 30+ telemetry event types capturing detailed analytics including typing patterns, feature usage, interaction metrics, and cross-platform activity. Multiple analytics endpoints receive behavioral data (felog, femetrics, gnar, Iterable). Persistent user identifiers enable long-term tracking.

Local storage of sensitive data including OAuth tokens (gr-oauth-key, oauth.tokens), user content cache (cachedRichTextOnServiceWorkerShutdown), and authentication credentials without evidence of encryption at rest. Relies solely on browser storage security mechanisms which may be vulnerable to local attacks or extensions.

Multiple potential privacy policy violations including: GDPR non-compliance (lack of explicit consent for data processing, excessive collection, undefined retention policies); CCPA concerns (limited transparency about data sharing); Chrome Web Store policy violations (extensive tracking and data collection may not be adequately disclosed to users). Processing of special category data (professional, educational content) without adequate safeguards.

Collection of device information, browser details, extension version, and behavioral patterns that could be used for browser fingerprinting and user tracking across websites. Persistent identifiers combined with behavioral data enable cross-site user identification.

Extension loads dynamic configuration from remote endpoints (config.extension.grammarly.com/dynamicConfig.json) which could potentially modify extension behavior. Integration with third-party platforms and services creates potential supply chain risks. No evidence of direct eval() or remote code execution but dynamic configuration loading presents theoretical risk.
